docs.title: Documentation
docs.subtitle: Everything you need to know about CorsBridge

content.errorHandlingContent: The proxy returns standard HTTP status codes:
content.error404: 404: Not Found - Target URL not found
content.queryParamsContent: You can add query parameters to your requests to control the behavior of the proxy.
content.whatIsDesc: CorsBridge is a free HTTP proxy service that eliminates CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) errors when making requests from browser-based applications.
content.whatIsContent: CorsBridge is a free, no-authentication HTTP proxy service that removes CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) errors when making requests from client-side apps to external APIs.
content.whyCors: Browsers block cross-origin requests by default for security reasons. CorsBridge acts as a middle layer, forwarding your request and adding appropriate CORS headers to the response.
content.quickStartDesc: Start with CorsBridge in seconds. Just add your target URL to our proxy base URL.
content.quickStartContent: Get started in 30 seconds. No signup, no configuration.
content.simplyPrepend: Simply prepend this to any API endpoint:
content.proxyFormatDesc: The format is simple ‚Äî append your target URL as a query parameter to the proxy endpoint.
content.urlStructure: Understanding the proxy request URL structure.
content.httpMethodsDesc: CorsBridge supports all standard HTTP methods including GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE.
content.httpMethodsSupport: CorsBridge supports all standard HTTP methods.
content.vanillaContent: Vanilla JavaScript is the simplest way to make HTTP requests in JavaScript.
content.vueContent: Vue.js is a popular JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.
content.nextjsContent: Next.js is a popular React framework for building server-side applications.
content.responseFormatContent: The response format is the same as the target URL response format.
content.responseHeaders: The response headers are the same as the target URL response headers.
content.fetchDesc: Fetch API is the modern way to make HTTP requests in JavaScript.
content.nativeBrowserFetch: The browser‚Äôs native Fetch API works seamlessly with CorsBridge.
content.axiosDesc: Axios is a popular HTTP client library for JavaScript.
content.axiosZeroConfig: Axios users can use CorsBridge with zero configuration changes.
content.reactDesc: Integrating CorsBridge with React is straightforward using hooks.
content.reactHooks: Use CorsBridge inside React components with hooks.
content.headersDesc: You can add custom headers, including authentication tokens, to your requests.
content.passCustomHeaders: Add custom headers to your requests.
content.faqA1: Yes! CorsBridge is completely free with no API key, authentication, or rate limits.
content.faqA2: No account required. Use the proxy URL directly in your code.
content.faqA3: There are currently no rate limits. We trust developers to use the service responsibly.
content.faqA4: All requests are proxied over HTTPS with proper SSL/TLS encryption.
content.faqReallyFree: Yes! CorsBridge is completely free with no API key or authentication.
content.faqNoApiKey: No API key required. Just use the proxy URL format.
content.faqProduction: Yes, but for high-traffic production applications, consider running your own CORS proxy for full control.
content.faqPrivacy: Requests are proxied but not logged. Always use HTTPS endpoints for sensitive data.
content.faqQ3Title: Can I use it in production?

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: No! CorsBridge is completely free and always will be. Donations are entirely voluntary and help sustain the project.
faq.a2: You can donate securely via GitHub Sponsors or Buy Me a Coffee. Both platforms offer secure payment processing.
faq.a3: All donations go towards covering server costs, developing new features, and improving the project.
faq.q4Title: What do I get after donating?
faq.a4: You'll receive thank you badges, early access features, and special roles on Discord. Most importantly, you contribute to open source!

cta.title: Ready to Support?
cta.description: Every contribution, no matter how small, helps keep the project alive.
